ARABIC: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So He threw down his staff and there it was, unmistakably a snake.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So (Moses) cast his staff, and lo, it turned into a living serpent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (No sooner had he said this than) Moses threw down his rod and behold, it was a veritable serpent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Moses threw his staff and suddenly it became a serpent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So Moosa put down his staff and it became a visible serpent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So he threw his stick, and behold, it was a serpent, manifest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So he cast down his rod, and lo! it was an obvious serpent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So he cast his staff, and behold, it was a serpent manifest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then he flung down his staff and it became a serpent manifest,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: So Moses threw down his staff and suddenly it appeared as a serpent, plainly visible.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then he cast down his staff, and lo! it was a serpent manifest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Thereat he threw down his staff, and behold, it was a manifest python.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So (Moses) threw his rod, and behold, it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So [Musa (Moses)] threw his stick, and behold, it was a serpent, manifest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He cast down his staff and thereupon it was a clear serpent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So he cast his staff; and it was a serpent, plain to see.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:32] So he threw down his staff, and lo! it was a manifest serpent, a great snake.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then he) Moses (flung down his staff and it became a serpent) a yellow, male serpent (manifest) as huge as any serpent can be,
